title: Japan PM says security balance 'difficult' after attack

title: Teck Resources separation plan backed by shareholder Sumitomo Metal
description: LONDON : Sumitomo Metal Mining on Thursday said it supports Teck Resources' plan to create two separate companies, as the Vancouver-based miner fends off an unsolicited takeover bid from mining giant Glencore. title: Over 11kg of drugs worth S$560,000 seized in raids, 35 people arrested
description: The nine-day operation was targeted at drug transactions conducted through encrypted chat applications, said the Central Narcotics Bureau.

title: Ong Ye Kung rebuts opposition MPs, says government does not dismiss concerns raised in parliament
description: Health Minister Ong Ye Kung said the government welcomes ideas by Members of Parliament and, "where appropriate", takes them in when formulating policies.
keywords: Singapore Parliament,The Workers' Party,Workers' Party,Progress Singapore Party

title: Hedge fund BFAM, others file lawsuit against Chinese developer for debt repayment
description: HONG KONG : Hedge fund BFAM Partners and a few other investors have filed a lawsuit in New York against Chinese property developer Glory Health, seeking $201 million in debt repayment, according to a court filing seen by Reuters.Hong Kong-based BFAM and some other investors outside of China were collectiv

title: Extra Hari Raya Puasa public holiday will not hurt private sector: Malaysian minister
description: Members of the business community in Malaysia have criticised the additional public holiday as it will result in losses that firms will have to incur.

title: South Korea announces $15 billion investment in advanced battery technologies
description: SEOUL : The South Korean government and its top battery companies plan to jointly invest 20 trillion won ($15.1 billion) through 2030 to develop advanced battery technologies including solid-state batteries, the industry ministry said on Thursday."The joint investment will allow South Korea to start comme

title: China's Changan Auto to invest $285 million in EV facility in Thailand
description: BANGKOK : Chinese auto maker Changan Auto will invest $285 million in a facility in Thailand to produce 100,000 electric vehicles (EVs) annually, Thailand's Board of Investment said on Thursday.The company aims to sell the EVs in Thailand, Southeast Asia, Australia, and South Africa, said the board's sec

title: Yellen calls for 'constructive and fair' US economic ties with China
description: WASHINGTON: The US seeks "constructive and fair" economic ties with China, but will protect its national security interests and push back against China's actions to dominate foreign comp

title: India court rejects Rahul Gandhi's plea for stay on conviction
description: AHMEDABAD:  An Indian court on Thursday (Apr 20) rejected a plea by top opposition figure Rahul Gandhi for a stay on a defamation conviction that prompted his expulsion

title: China may cut oil products export quotas in second batch for 2023
description: SINGAPORE : China may cut quotas for refined oil products exports in a second batch for 2023 as domestic demand improves while the need to boost its economy through oil products abates, a Reuters survey showed.A reduction in oil products exports from the world's second-largest refiner could help ease over

title: Under-pressure Bayern shift focus to Bundesliga and in-form Mainz
description: MUNICH, Germany : Bayern Munich's players and coach Thomas Tuchel have no time to digest Wednesday's painful Champions League exit to Manchester City with the Bundesliga the only title left to fight for and in-form Mainz 05 posing the next obstacle in a rocky season.The reigning champions are in top spot

title: Cambodia PM Hun Sen's son becomes four-star general
description: PHNOM PENH: Cambodian leader Hun Sen's eldest son was officially promoted to the rank of four-star general on Thursday (Apr 20), in another sign of plans for him to succeed his father. Hun Sen has publicly backed Hun Manet to lead the kingdom in the future. Hun Manet, who is commander of the army

title: Huawei launches in-house software system after being cut off from US services
description: SHENZHEN, China : China's Huawei Technologies said on Thursday it is replacing internal software management systems it once sourced from U.S. vendors with its own in-house version, hailing it as a victory over U.S. curbs that once threatened its survival. title: Elon Musk's SpaceX set to launch first test flight of Starship rocket system
description: BOCA CHICA, Texas : Elon Musk's SpaceX aimed on Thursday to launch the company's next-generation Starship spacecraft atop its powerful Super Heavy rocket for the first time, on a highly anticipated but brief uncrewed test flight from the Gulf Coast of Texas.Final preparations were under way at the company

title: Dreaming sky high, Nigerian man builds airplane from trash
description: LAGOS : Bolaji Fatai has never set foot in an airplane, but that hasn't stopped him from building his own remote-controlled model aircraft from trash and sending it soaring over the sprawl and chaos of Lagos, Nigeria's commercial capital.On a recent cloudy day, the single-propeller plane withstood cross-w

title: England's Middleton raises concerns over future of Women's Six Nations
description: England head coach Simon Middleton has raised concerns about the future of the Women's Six Nations, with his team and France dominating the tournament over the last several years. title: Nadal to miss Madrid Open after recovery setback
description: MADRID : Rafa Nadal will miss next week's Madrid Open after a setback in his recovery from a hip injury sustained at the Australian Open in January, the 22-times major champion said on Thursday.Nadal skipped tournaments at Indian Wells, Miami and Monte Carlo as well as the current Barcelona Open after suf

title: Exeter's Nowell fined US$12,400 for tweet criticising referee
description: Exeter Chiefs' Jack Nowell has been fined £10,000 (US$12,400) and directed to undertake a referees' course after the England wing criticised a Premiership referee's decision on Twitter, the Rugby Football Union (RFU) said on Thursday (Apr 20).
